title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: missandei
text: missandei: Yes, your grace.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: grey
text: grey: Missandei. *in Valyrian* I have come to apologize.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: missandei
text: missandei: in Valyrian* You don't need to apologize.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: grey
text: grey: in Valyrian* I hope I didn't frighten you.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: missandei
text: missandei: in Valyrian* No.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: grey
text: grey: The lessons you give I in Common tongue, these are precious to I.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: missandei
text: missandei: To me.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: grey
text: grey: To me.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: missandei
text: missandei: I don't remember teaching you the word precious.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: grey
text: grey: Jorah the Andal, he teaches I...he teaches me this word.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: missandei
text: missandei: Do you remember the name you were given at birth?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: grey
text: grey: I remember nothing. Only unsullied.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: missandei
text: missandei: When they cut you, do you remember that?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: missandei
text: missandei: I'm sorry. I'm sorry they did that to you.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: grey
text: grey: Why? Why sorry?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: missandei
text: missandei: It's a terrible thing to do to a boy.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: grey
text: grey: approaches Missandei* If the masters never cut me, I am never unsullied. I never stand in the Plaza of Pride when Daenerys Stormborn orders us to kill the masters. I never am chosen to lead the unsullied. I never meet Missandei from the Island of Naath. I am sorry I...for today. I am sorry.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: missandei
text: missandei: in Valyrian* Grey Worm.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: missandei
text: missandei: in Valyrian* I'm glad you saw me.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: grey
text: grey: in Valyrian* So am I.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ramsay
text: ramsay: Bracken. Mmm, strong. As long as they're in the see. But when you take them out of the water, no bones. They collapse under their proud weight and slum into a heap of nothing. You'd think they'd know that. Unfortunately they're not very bright. What do you tell them?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: theon
text: theon: I'm Theon Greyjoy, son of Balon, heir to the Iron Islands.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ramsay
text: ramsay: And what are you really?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: theon
text: theon: I'm Reek.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ramsay
text: ramsay: Are you sure? You do look very much like a lord. Formidable, proud.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ramsay
text: ramsay: Until when?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: theon
text: theon: Always. Forever.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ramsay
text: ramsay: That's right. Until you're rotting in the ground. Remember what you are and what you're not. Bring me Lord Kenning.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: guard
text: guard: to Theon* No closer. Who are you?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ralf
text: ralf: I'm Kenning, commander of this garrison. And you say you're Theon Greyjoy?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: theon
text: theon: Yes.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ralf
text: ralf: And why should I believe that?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: theon
text: theon: I was born on Pike to Balon Greyjoy. His third and last-living son. I am your prince. I swear it by the drowned god. What is dead may never die.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: everyone
text: everyone: What is dead may never die.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ralf
text: ralf: And if you were my prince, why are you marching with a Bolton army?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: theon
text: theon: Lord Bolton took me captive after Winterfell. He sent me to treat with you in good faith as your fellow Ironborn.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ralf
text: ralf: And what does Lord Bolton want?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: theon
text: theon: You are fading from sickness. You are badly outnumbered and you're hundreds of miles from the sea. Lord Bolton implores you to protect your men and abandon this fortress you can no longer hold. Do this and he will be just and fair with you as he is being with me. The Boltons will give you safe passage to the stony shore.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ralf
text: ralf: He wants us to surrender?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: theon
text: theon: My own father, your king, surrendered years ago to Robert Baratheon. I watched him bend the knee. There was no shame there. He fought with honor, as did you.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ralf
text: ralf: shame fought with honor.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: theon
text: theon: I'm sorry, I didn't hear...

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ralf
text: ralf: No shame fought with honor. Only a whipped dog would speak this way. Or a woman. Are you a woman boy?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: theon
text: theon: scared* You don't know.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ralf
text: ralf: The Ironborn will not surrender.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: theon
text: theon: whispering* Reek. Reek.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ralf
text: ralf: You go tell your master that, Theon Greyjoy. Or whoever the fuck you are. What in the hell are you muttering?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: theon
text: theon: Reek.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: man
text: man: If we yield, we live? Is that what it says on this paper here?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: theon
text: theon: Yes. Have your men raise the white flag and open the gates. You're going home.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ramsay
text: ramsay: You didn't really think I'd let them go did you? It's falling out of fashion. Fileting. Sad, but true. Traditions are important. Where are we without our history, eh?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: theon
text: theon: Yes m'lord. Will we go home now?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ramsay
text: ramsay: I believe we will. To our new home.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: A great-grandfather from Braavos, yes. I suppose all of our ancestors came from somewhere else originally.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lord
text: lord: Our forebearers settled the Vale thousands of years ago. We've fought off invaders ever since.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: The beauty of the Vale is matched only by the nobility of its great families. Lady Arryn often told me that you were her rock, Lord Royce.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lord
text: lord: She told me nothing about you, Baelish. But I didn't need to hear from her. Moneylender. Whoremonger. You've been licking Tywin Lannister's boots so long, it's a wonder your tongue's not black.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: My lord...

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lord
text: lord: And when Jon Arryn named you Master of Coin, no one cared. Always been a grubby job. Why not let a grubby man do it? But when I heard you were lurking here, fawning over the Lady Arryn...

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: Lady Arryn invited me. She and I have been close since childhood.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lady
text: lady: Yes, we all know how close you were. Lady Arryn's predilections were her own affair. Her death is our affair.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: Of course. Her suicide shattered us all.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lady
text: lady: She was an odd fish. Everyone knew that. But suicide? She adored that boy of hers. I don't see her abandoning him. Not by choice.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lord
text: lord: Strange that within days of your arrival, you've married Lady Arryn and she's fallen through the Moon Door.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: She was always prone to melancholy. My lady wasn't meant for a world as brutal as ours.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lord
text: lord: We were told there was a witness. A girl.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lady
text: lady: A niece of yours, I believe.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: A girl with no learning and scattered wits. I assure you, she would be of no help.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lord
text: lord: We'd like to speak with her.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: Let me fetch her.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lady
text: lady: No need. We prefer to hear her testimony unadulterated.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lady
text: lady: Come closer, child. You have nothing to fear from us or him. Lord Baelish here is your uncle? Your name is Alayne? Perhaps you would feel more comfortable if Lord Baelish left the room.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: My lady...

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lady
text: lady: I wasn't asking you.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: sansa
text: sansa: He can stay.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lord
text: lord: Speak up, girl, you're not a damn kitchen mouse. Tell us what you saw.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: sansa
text: sansa: to Petyr* I'm sorry, Lord Baelish. I have to tell the truth. *to the council* I'll tell you everything.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lady
text: lady: Please, Alayne, leave nothing out.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: sansa
text: sansa: My name is not Alayne. It's Sansa Stark, eldest daughter of Lord Eddard Stark. Lord Royce, we met when you came to Winterfell. You were escorting your son Ser Waymar to the Wall.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lord
text: lord: Sansa Stark? You tell lies right to my face, you little worm?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: sansa
text: sansa: Lord Baelish has told many lies. All to protect me. Since my father was executed, I have been a hostage in King's Landing. A plaything for Joffrey to torture or Queen Cersei to torment. They beat me, they humiliated me, they married me to the Imp. I had no friends in King's Landing...except one. He saved me. Smuggled me away when he had the chance. He knew I'd be safe here in the Eyrie with my own blood, my Aunt Lysa. The Lannisters have friends everywhere. Even the Vale. He made me swear not to tell anyone my true name.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: Your secret is safe with us, my lady.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lord
text: lord: Your father grew up right here in these halls. We hunted together many times. He was a fine man.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lady
text: lady: Tell us what happened to your aunt, Sansa.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: sansa
text: sansa: You knew her well, my lords, my lady. You knew she was a troubled woman. She always loved Lord Baelish. She told me herself. From the moment he arrived at the gates of Riverrun, a boy of eight carrying everything he owned in a little sack. She confessed to me she never loved Lord Arryn. She did as her father commanded, as so many of us have. When the gods finally allowed her to be with Lord Baelish, she was so happy. For a time. My aunt was a jealous lady. She was terrified that Lord Baelish didn't love her anymore. That he would abandon her for a younger woman. And then...one day she saw him kiss me.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lord
text: lord: Lady Sansa.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: sansa
text: sansa: It was a peck on the cheek, Lord Royce, nothing more. Lord Baelish is my uncle now, in truth, by marriage. He's always been so kind to me. I was so happy to be here, to be free. All because of him. But my aunt turned on me. She cursed me. Called me a whore. Promised to throw me through the Moon Door. When Lord Baelish tried to calm her, she struck him. She said she didn't want to live anymore. She stood on the edge of that Moon Door. He tried to reason with her. Promised her she was the only one he had ever loved, but she stepped through those doors and she was...*begins sobbing*

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lady
text: lady: Shh. Shh, it's not your fault, sweet girl. It's not your fault.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lord
text: lord: You could see it in the way she raised that boy. Feeding him from her own teats when he was 10 years old.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lady
text: lady: Lord Royce! This is hardly the time.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lord
text: lord: Apologies, my lady. And to you as well, Baelish. We treated you a bit harshly.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: You want justice, Lord Royce. I can hardly complain about that. I want the same.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lady
text: lady: Not much justice to be meted out in suicide, is there?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: For Lysa, no. But for her son? Only 20 years ago, the knights of the Vale rode behind Jon Arryn, Ned Stark, Robert Baratheon. They fought together to overcome the Mad King. And since then, Arryn and Royce, Corbray, Waynwood, all the great houses of the Vale watched from the corner. A timid boy at a tavern brawl.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lord
text: lord: Are you questioning our courage?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: I want to know which side you're on. Do you support the Lannisters, the house that executed your friend Ned Stark?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lord
text: lord: Of course we don't support the damn Lannisters.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: No? Catelyn Stark begged her sister for support and Lysa refused. By staying out of the fray, you've allowed Tywin Lannister to destroy his rivals on every compass point. Who stands against him now?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lady
text: lady: Who would you have us back, Lord Baelish? Robb Stark is dead.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: I'd have you back Robin Arryn, Lord of the Vale.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lady
text: lady: Robin Arryn is a sickly little boy.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: And sickly little boys sometimes become powerful men.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lady
text: lady: More often they die young.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: I adored Lysa with all my heart. But she loved her son so much, she became overprotective. He needs to learn how to swing a sword. How to ride a horse.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lord
text: lord: Aye, it's time.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: Yes, it's time. Time for him to tour the Vale, to visit all the castles in his domain. Time for Robin to leave the nest.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: boy
text: boy: Ser Barristan.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: Yes? Who sent you?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: Ser Barristan.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: Ser Jorah.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: Have I forgotten a council meeting?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: No.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: What's this?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: A royal pardon signed by Robert Baratheon. You spied on her.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: Who gave you this?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: Does it matter?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: Have you told her?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: I wanted to tell you first, man-to-man rather than go behind your back.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: Let me speak with her in private.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: You'll never be alone with her again.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: Why did the usurper pardon you?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: If we could speak alone.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: No, speak to me here. Explain it to me.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: Who do you think sent this to Meereen? Who profits? This is the work of Tywin Lannister. He wants to divide us. If we're fighting each other, we're not fighting him.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: The pardon was signed the year we met. Why were you pardoned? Unless you're saying this document was forged.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: It is not forged.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: Why, then?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: I sent letters to Varys, the spymaster of King's Landing.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: What was the content of these letters?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: Information.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: What information?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: When you and Viserys arrived in Pentos. His plan to marry you to Khal Drogo. When you were married. When your brother died.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: You told him I was carrying Drogo's child?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: I...

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: Yes or no?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: Khaleesi.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: Don't call me that. Did you tell him I was carrying Drogo's child?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: Yes.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: That wine merchant tried to poison me because of your information.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: I stopped you from drinking his wine.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: Because you knew it was poisoned.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: I suspected.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: You betrayed me from the first.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: Forgive me. I never meant...please, Khaleesi, forgive me.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: You sold my secrets to the man who killed my father and stole my brother's throne...

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: I have protected you. Fought for you. Killed for you.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: and you want me to forgive you?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: I have loved you.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: Love? Love? How can you say that to me? Any other man, and I would have you executed. But you, I do not want you in my city dead or alive. Go back to your masters in King's Landing. Collect your pardon if you can.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ser
text: ser: Daenerys, please.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: Don't ever presume to touch me again or speak my name. You have until dusk to collect your things and leave this city. If you're found in Meereen past break of day, I'll have your head thrown into Slaver's Bay. Go. Now.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ramsay
text: ramsay: Moat Cailin is yours, Father.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: lord
text: lord: Walk with me. Has there been any word from Locke?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ramsay
text: ramsay: No.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ramsay
text: ramsay: Unimportant. A cripple, a young boy. None of the northern lords have seen them. Dead most likely. Most of the Ironborn have fled the North. Now more will follow, thanks to you. Tell me what you see.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ramsay
text: ramsay: Moors, fields, hills.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ramsay
text: ramsay: Tell me what you see.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ramsay
text: ramsay: Nothing.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: roose
text: roose: Not nothing. The North. Ride 700 miles that way, you're still in the North. 400 miles that way. 300 miles that way. The North is larger than the other six kingdoms combined. And I am the Warden of the North. The North is mine. Now tell me, what is your name?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ramsay
text: ramsay: Ramsay Snow.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: roose
text: roose: No, not Ramsay Snow. *hands Ramsay a scroll* Open it. From this day until your last day, you are Ramsay Bolton, son of Roose Bolton, Warden of the North.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ramsay
text: ramsay: You honor me. I swear I will uphold your name and your tradition. I will be worthy of you, Father, I promise.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ramsay
text: ramsay: Come, Reek, I'll be needing a bath.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: sansa
text: sansa: Yes?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: First time I saw you, you were just a child. A girl from the North come to the capital for the first time. Not a child any longer. Why did you help me?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: sansa
text: sansa: They would have thrown you through the Moon Door if they found you guilty.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: That's not an answer.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: sansa
text: sansa: If they'd have executed you, what would they have done with me?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: I don't know.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: sansa
text: sansa: Neither do I.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: Better to gamble on the man you know than the strangers you don't? And you think you know me?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: sansa
text: sansa: I know what you want.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: Do you?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: sandor
text: sandor: I thought it'd make me happy, but it doesn't. Not really. Nothing makes you happy.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: arya
text: arya: Lots of things make me happy.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: sandor
text: sandor: Like what?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: arya
text: arya: Killing Polliver, killing Rorge.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: sandor
text: sandor: So you're sad because you didn't get to kill Joffrey yourself. Is that it?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: arya
text: arya: At least I could have been there to watch. I wanted to see the look in his eyes when he knew it was over.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: sandor
text: sandor: Aye, nothing in the world beats that look.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: arya
text: arya: You protected him for most of his life. You think you could have saved him?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: sandor
text: sandor: I wasn't the damn wine taster. Little shit deserved to die, but poison...poison's a woman's weapon. Men kill with steel.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: arya
text: arya: That's your stupid pride talking. It's why you'll never be a great killer. I'd have killed Joffrey with a chicken bone if I had to.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: sandor
text: sandor: laughs* I'd pay good money to see that. *grunts and rubs his neck*

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: arya
text: arya: You should have let me burn it.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: sandor
text: sandor: It's a fleabite.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: arya
text: arya: That fleabite's got you walking a lot slower than you used to.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: sandor
text: sandor: Well, we won't have to walk too much further.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: arya
text: arya: You really think my aunt will pay for me?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: sandor
text: sandor: Aye, she'll pay.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: arya
text: arya: I've never even met her.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: sandor
text: sandor: Doesn't matter. You're her blood. Family, honor, all that horseshit. It's all you lords and ladies ever talk about.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: arya
text: arya: I'm not a lady.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: guard
text: guard: Who would pass the Bloody Gate?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: sandor
text: sandor: The bloody Hound, Sandor Clegane. And his...traveling companion Arya Stark, niece of your lady Lysa Arryn.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: guard
text: guard: Then I offer my condolences. Lady Arryn died. Three days ago.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: robin
text: robin: I've never left home before, Uncle Petyr. I'm afraid to leave.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: You shouldn't be.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: robin
text: robin: The Lord of the Vale belongs in the Eyrie, Mother said. She said it's not safe outside.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: petyr
text: petyr: It wasn't safe for her inside. People die at their dinner tables. They die in their beds. They die squatting over their chamber pots. Everybody dies sooner or later. Don't worry about your death. Worry about your life. Take charge of your life for as long as it lasts. That is what it means to be Lord of the Vale.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: sansa
text: sansa: Shall we go?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: tyrion
text: tyrion: Wine always helps. I thank you for it. Trial by combat. Deciding a man's guilt or innocence in the eyes of the gods by having two other men hack each other to pieces. Tells you something about the gods. How much longer?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: jaime
text: jaime: Soon.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: tyrion
text: tyrion: Do you think Oberyn has a chance? The Red Viper of Dorne. You don't get a name like that unless you're deadly, right?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: jaime
text: jaime: I've never seen him fight.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: tyrion
text: tyrion: Oh, he's going to die. I'm going to die.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: jaime
text: jaime: Oberyn believes in himself.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: tyrion
text: tyrion: That's putting it mildly. What's the punishment for regicide? Drawing and quartering? Hanging? Breaking at the wheel?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: jaime
text: jaime: Beheading.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: tyrion
text: tyrion: Seems rather ordinary. And he was my nephew as well, so what is that? Fratricide is brothers. Filicide is sons. Nepoticide. That's the one. Matricide, patricide, infanticide, suicide. There's no kind of killing that doesn't have its own word.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: jaime
text: jaime: Cousins.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: tyrion
text: tyrion: Cousins, you're right. There is no word for cousin killing. Well done. Do you remember cousin Orson? Orson Lannister?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: jaime
text: jaime: Of course. Wet-nurse dropped him on his head. Left him simple.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: tyrion
text: tyrion: Simple? Used to sit all day in the garden. Crushing beetles with a rock.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: together
text: together: Khuu! Khuu! Khuu!

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: tyrion
text: tyrion: Nothing made him happier.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: jaime
text: jaime: Nothing made you happier. You'd think being tormented from birth would have given you some affinity for the afflicted.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: tyrion
text: tyrion: On the contrary. Laughing at another person's misery was the only thing that made me feel like everyone else.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: jaime
text: jaime: The joke wore thin, though.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: tyrion
text: tyrion: For you. You drifted away.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: jaime
text: jaime: I had other interests.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: tyrion
text: tyrion: Yes, other interests. But I stayed with Orson.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: jaime
text: jaime: Why?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: tyrion
text: tyrion: I was curious. Why was he smashing all those beetles? What did he get out of it? First thing I did was ask him. "Orson, why are you smashing all those beetles?" He gave me an answer. "Smash the beetles. Smash 'em. Khuu! Khuu! Khuu!" I wasn't deterred. I was the smartest person I knew. Certainly I had the wherewithal to unravel the mysteries that lay at the heart of a moron. So I went to Maester Volarik's library.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: jaime
text: jaime: Volarik. Tried to touch me once.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: tyrion
text: tyrion: Turns out, far too much has been written about great men and not nearly enough about morons. Doesn't seem right. In any case, I found nothing that illuminated the nature of Orson's affliction or the reason behind his relentless beetle slaughter. So I went back to the source. I may not have been able to speak with Orson, but I could observe him, watch him the way men watch animals to come to a deeper understanding of their behavior. *picks up a beetle* And as I watched, I became more and more sure of it. There was something happening there. His face was like the page of a book written in a language I didn't understand. But he wasn't mindless. He had his reasons. And I became possessed with knowing what they were. I began to spend inordinate amounts of time watching him. I would eat my lunch in the garden, chewing my mutton to the music of "khuu, khuu, khuu". And when I wasn't watching him, I was thinking about him. Father droned on about the family legacy and I thought about Orson's beetles. I read the histories of Targaryen conquests. Did I hear dragon wings? No. I heard "khuu, khuu, khuu" and I still couldn't figure out why he was doing it. And I had to know, because it was horrible that all these beetles should be dying for no reason.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: jaime
text: jaime: Every day around the world, men, women, and children are murdered by the score. Who gives a dusty fuck about a bunch of beetles?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: tyrion
text: tyrion: I know, I know. But still, it filled me with dread. Piles and piles of them, years and years of them. How many countless living crawling things smashed and dried out and returned to the dirt? In my dreams I found myself standing on a beach made of beetle husks stretching as far as the eye could see. I woke up crying, weeping for their shattered little bodies. I tried to stop Orson once.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: jaime
text: jaime: He was twice your size.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: tyrion
text: tyrion: He just pushed me aside with a "khuu" and kept on smashing. Every day until that mule kicked him in the chest and killed him. *puts the beetle back on the ground* So what do you think? Why did he do it? What was it all about?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: jaime
text: jaime: I don't know.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: jaime
text: jaime: Good luck today.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: tyrion
text: tyrion: Looks like very light armor.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: oberyn
text: oberyn: I like to move around.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: tyrion
text: tyrion: You could at least wear a helmet. You shouldn't drink before a fight.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: oberyn
text: oberyn: You learn this during your years in the fighting pits? I always drink before a fight.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: tyrion
text: tyrion: It could get you killed. It could get me killed.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: oberyn
text: oberyn: Today is not the day I die.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ellaria
text: ellaria: You're going to fight that?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: oberyn
text: oberyn: I'm going to kill that.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ellaria
text: ellaria: He is the biggest man I've ever seen.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: oberyn
text: oberyn: Size does not matter when you are flat on your back.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: tyrion
text: tyrion: Thank the gods.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: pycell
text: pycell: In the sight of gods and men, we gather to ascertain the guilt or innocence of this...man Tyrion Lannister. May the Mother grant them mercy. May the Father give them such justice as they deserve. And may the Warrior guide the hand of our champion...

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: ellaria
text: ellaria: Don't leave me alone in this world.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: oberyn
text: oberyn: Never.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: oberyn
text: oberyn: Have they told you who I am?

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: mountain
text: mountain: Some dead man.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: oberyn
text: oberyn: I am the brother of Elia Martell. Do you know why I have come all the way to this stinking shit-pile of a city? For you.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: oberyn
text: oberyn: I'm going to hear you confess before you die. You raped my sister. You murdered her. You killed her children. Say it now and we can make this quick.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: oberyn
text: oberyn: Say it. You raped her. You murdered her. You killed her children.

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: oberyn
text: oberyn: You raped her! You murdered her! You killed her children!

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: oberyn
text: oberyn: You raped her! You murdered her!

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: oberyn
text: oberyn: You killed her children!

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: oberyn
text: oberyn: Wait. Are you dying? No, no, no. You can't die yet. You haven't confessed. Say it. Say her name. Elia Martell. You raped her. You killed her children. Elia Martell. Who gave you the order? Who gave you the order?! Say her name! You raped her! You murdered her! You killed her children. Say it. Say her name. Say it!

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: mountain
text: mountain: Elia Martell. I killed her children. Then I raped her. Then I smashed her head in like this!

title: The Mountain and the Viper
Name: tywin
text: tywin: standing up* The gods have made their will known. Tyrion Lannister, in the name of King Tommen of the House Baratheon, First of His Name, you are hereby sentenced to death.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: What was she like?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: She...she had red hair.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Oh? How big were her feet?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: Well what do you want me to say?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: I want you to tell me what it was like to have someone. To be with someone. To love someone and have them love you back. We're all gonna die a lot sooner than I'd planned. You're the closest I'll ever get to know it.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: So you and Gilly never-

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: No...she just had a baby! ...and she never offered.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: But if she had, you wouldo ve? You'd have broken your vows?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: The interesting thing is, our vows never specifically forbid intimate relations with women.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: What?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: I shall take no wife" yes, that's in there, there's no denying that. "I shall father no children" it's very specific. But what our vows have to say about other...activities...is open to interpretation.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: I don't think Ser Alliser cares much for interpretation.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Anyway, there's nothing for him to interpret. We didn't. So what's it like?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: It's...there's this person, this whole other person. And you're wrapped up in them and they're wrapped up in you and...you...for a little...for a little while you're more than just you, you're...well I don't know, I'm not a bleedin' poet!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: No, you're really not.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: And what did I get for it? An arrow six inches from my heart.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: There'll be arrows for all of us soon I imagine.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: There will.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: They've already done the worst thing to me they could ever do.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: Go get some sleep, Sam. I'll take this watch.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: tormund
text: tormund: Did I ever tell you about her? My Sheila?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: ygritte
text: ygritte: Yes.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: tormund
text: tormund: Oh that was a night to remember. Of course, I'd had a good bit to drink *laughs* the fangs were sharp, but she knew how to use them. And she was nice and soft down below. No, she was no ordinary beast. Many's the man who--

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: ygritte
text: ygritte: I know you never fucked a bear. You know you never fucked a bear. Right now I don't wanna think about the bear you never fucked. Right now all I want to think about is each one of these arrows finding its way into a Crow's heart.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: tormund
text: tormund: We could be waiting here a while.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: ygritte
text: ygritte: Good. The longer we wait, the more arrows I'll have. When they came up here, to our land, and put up a big wall and said it was their's. Then they started hunting us down. But this time, we're the one's doing the hunting.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: styr
text: styr: You've got a lot to say about killing. Even more words than arrows.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: ygritte
text: ygritte: Back in those villages I killed just as many of them as you did. More, I reckon.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: styr
text: styr: Yes. But none of those were your Crow lover.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: ygritte
text: ygritte: I probably killed him already.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: styr
text: styr: So you've said.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: ygritte
text: ygritte: And if not. The only thing left of him is gonna be his fun-bits hanging around me neck.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: styr
text: styr: And more words. Know what I think you do when you see him? Serve him up a nice juicy slice of ginger minge.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: ygritte
text: ygritte: What, you been thinkin' about that ginger minge? Wondering what it tastes like?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: styr
text: styr: Maybe I have.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: ygritte
text: ygritte: Jon Snow is mine. *shouting* Anyone else tries to kill him, I'll have an arrow for them. *to Styr* And not one of your bald friends is fast enough to stop me.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: aemon
text: aemon: And what is it that couldn't wait until morning, Tarly?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Maester Aemon. How did you know-

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: aemon
text: aemon: That it was you? Who else but Samwell Tarly would be wasting candles to read in the middle of the night?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Let me help you.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: aemon
text: aemon: Oh, no need. I know my way around this library better than any other place in Castle Black. Thousands of books and no eyes to read them. Old age is a wonderful source of ironies if nothing else. But you didn't answer my question, what are you reading?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Maester Faull

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: aemon
text: aemon: Ah, the Wildlings. I can assure you that the closest Maester Faull ever got to a Wildling was this very library.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: But what he says about what they do...it's all true. It's exactly what the survivors of their raids report.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: aemon
text: aemon: Yes. Imagine the stories Wildlings tell about us! Love is the death of duty. I told that to your friend Jon Snow once. He didn't listen and neither did you. That's why you abandoned your watch atop the wall to come here and read about the things that may have happened to the girl you love.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: I don't love her.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: aemon
text: aemon: Yes you do.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: No.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: aemon
text: aemon: Yes you do! I heard it in your voice when you first brought her to me. I remember how it sounds! I was in love once.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: You were?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: aemon
text: aemon: You can imagine all manner of horrors befalling that poor girl and her child, is it so difficult to imagine that an old person was once, more or less, like you?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: I'm sorry Maester, I didn't mean it like that.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: aemon
text: aemon: You know who I was before I came here? What I couldo ve been if I'd only said the word? Of course you do. I met many girls when I was Aemon Targaryen. A future king always does. Some of them were quite forward in their attempts to win my affections. One of them succeeded. I was very young.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Who was she?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: aemon
text: aemon: Ah ha. I could tell you everything about her. Who she was. How we met. The color of her eyes and the shape of her nose. I can see her right in front of me. She's more real than you are. We could spend all night trading tales of lost love. Nothing makes the past a sweeter place to visit than the prospect of imminent death. Go to bed Tarly.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: pyp
text: pyp: I'm sorry, I can't open the gate for nobody. It's orders!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: gilly
text: gilly: They killed everyone! Everyone but me and my baby. And they're out there. I saw them on the way here, they may have seen me, they may have followed me please!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: pyp
text: pyp: I'm sorry, I can't.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: gilly
text: gilly: If they find the boy, you don't know what they'll do.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Pyp! Open the gate.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: pyp
text: pyp: I can't.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: gilly
text: gilly: Sam, is that you?!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Yes!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: pyp
text: pyp: Thorne gave me strict orders to not open the gate.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Oh, Pyp. Open the fucking gate!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: pyp
text: pyp: I've never heard you curse before.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Yes, well, best get used to it.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Are you alright? Shh, you're alright. Yeah, of course you are my brave little fella.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: gilly
text: gilly: It was horrible.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: I'm so so sorry. I didn't know until I got back.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: gilly
text: gilly: Don't let them send me away, Sam.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Never.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: gilly
text: gilly: I know there's no women allowed.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Anyone who tries to throw you out will be having words with me. From now on, wherever you go, I go too.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: alliser
text: alliser: Get ready!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: thenn
text: thenn: It's time.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: janos
text: janos: Pick up the pace!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: There we go, boys. That's one. There's two. Come on, let's get the next lot. That's the last of the oil, Ser Alliser.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: alliser
text: alliser: A hundred thousand you say?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: Yes sir.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: alliser
text: alliser: You can say it if you like. We shouldo ve sealed the tunnel while we had the chance like you suggested.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: It was a difficult decision either way, Ser.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: alliser
text: alliser: Do you know what leadership means, Lord Snow? It means that the person in charge gets second-guessed by every clever little twat with a mouth. But if he starts second-guessing himself, that's the end. For him. For the clever little twats. For everyone. This is not the end. Not for us. Not if you lot do your duty for however long it takes to beat them back. And then you get to go on hating me and I get to go on wishing your Wildling whore had finished the job.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: You'll be safe down here. I'll check on you as soon as I can.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: gilly
text: gilly: You're leaving me again?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: I'm not leaving you!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: gilly
text: gilly: You're going up there and we're staying down here. That's leaving. You said from now on we'd stay together.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: I...I didn't mean in the same room.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: gilly
text: gilly: What are you going to do out there?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Help my brothers.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: gilly
text: gilly: How?! You going to fight the Free Folk when they come? They'll kill you. In Molestown they killed everyone.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: I can't just hide here with you while they're fighting out there.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: gilly
text: gilly: Why not? You won't matter up there, you will down here.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Look. I am a man of the Night's Watch, Gilly. I made a promise to defend The Wall and I have to keep it, because that's what men do.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: gilly
text: gilly: Promise me you won't die.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: I promise you I won't die.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: There's a lot more Wildlings on the other side of the wall than this side. We've got us some weapons and things. This is the perfect place for us to be.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: pyp
text: pyp: I've never thrown a spear before. I've never held a sword with a proper edge. There's no place for me to be. You're not afraid?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Of course I'm afraid, there's a band of Wildlings coming to kill us.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: pyp
text: pyp: Well if you're afraid of a band of Wildlings, how in seven hells did you manage to kill a White Walker?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: I didn't know I was going to kill it, but I had to do something I didn't have any choice, he was going to kill Gilly and take the baby. If someone had asked me my name right then, I wouldn't have known. I wasn't Samwell Tarly anymore. I wasn't a Steward in the Night's Watch or son of Randyll Tarly or any of that. I was nothing at all. And when you're nothing at all, there's no more reason to be afraid.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: pyp
text: pyp: But you're afraid now?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Yes, well, I'm not nothing anymore.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: ygritte
text: ygritte: Most of their men are up top. Didn't count more than twenty down there. Leftovers. They've got a little fat one and a little bony one manning the front.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: styr
text: styr: How high are the walls?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: ygritte
text: ygritte: Well, we'll be up and over before they know what's happened.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: tormund
text: tormund: Let's kill some Crows!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: tormund
text: tormund: yells* Come on! *puts out the fire*

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: alliser
text: alliser: Archers knock, everyone else hold.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: alliser
text: alliser: I said knock and hold you cunts! Does knock mean draw?!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: nights
text: nights: No Ser!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: alliser
text: alliser: Does fucking hold mean fucking drop?!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: alliser
text: alliser: You all plan to die here tonight?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: alliser
text: alliser: That's very good to hear. Draw!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: member
text: member: Help, down below.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: janos
text: janos: They're attacking the southern gates!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: alliser
text: alliser: Now?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: janos
text: janos: Now!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: alliser
text: alliser: I'm going down then. Brother Slynt, you have The Wall.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: janos
text: janos: What?!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: alliser
text: alliser: What are you fucking waiting for, loose!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: janos
text: janos: You heard the man. Loose!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: tormund
text: tormund: You, over there.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Did you get one?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: pyp
text: pyp: No. Ah shit, Pyp. Shit. Sam.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Yeah?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: pyp
text: pyp: I think we're gonna die.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: If you keep missing we will.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: alliser
text: alliser: Brothers! A hundred generations have defended this castle. We've never fallen before. She will not fall tongiht. Those are Things at our walls. They eat the flesh of the men they kill. Do you want to fill the belly of a Thing tonight?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: nights
text: nights: No!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: alliser
text: alliser: Tonight we fight. And when the sun rises I promise you, Castle Black will stand.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: alliser
text: alliser: The Night's Watch will stand.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: alliser
text: alliser: With me now! Now, with me!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: janos
text: janos: No discipline. No training. Gang of thieves, that's all this is. I commanded the city watch of King's Landing. Those men obeyed orders.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: We can't just let them attack the gate!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: janos
text: janos: The bars of those gates are four inches of cold, rolled steel.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: Those are giants riding mammoths down there. Do you think your cold, rolled steel's gonna stop them?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: janos
text: janos: No such thing as giants. They're stories for the children.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: grenn
text: grenn: Brother Slynt! I've just got word that Ser Alliser needs you below. You're the most experienced man he's got, he said he needs ya.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: janos
text: janos: Needed below? Yes. Yes.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: Archers! Knock your arrows! Draw! Loose!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: They won't summit before dawn.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: grenn
text: grenn: How do you know that?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: Because I've made that claim.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: ed
text: ed: I think they're in a bigger hurry than you were.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: Knock! Draw! Loose!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: pyp
text: pyp: I got one. Right through the heart, he's dead.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Oh, is it over?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: pyp
text: pyp: Huh?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Well then. *hands Pyp a loaded crossbow*

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: You're alright. You're alright. I'll get help. Shh, shh. Maester Aemon is coming, he's gonna make it alright.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: Now!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: ed
text: ed: Now!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: to Grenn* The outer gate won't hold. Take five men, hold the inner gate.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: grenn
text: grenn: Alright.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: grabs Grenn's arm* Hold the gate. If they make it through...

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: grenn
text: grenn: They won't. Come on Hill! And you Cooper! You three, on me! Come on you lazy bastards!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: Oil!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: ed
text: ed: Oil on the ramp!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: alliser
text: alliser: Protect the gate!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: alliser
text: alliser: Hold the fucking gate! Hold it!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: to Grenn* We need more men down here.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: grenn
text: grenn: We have to hold the gate.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: But we need men here.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: grenn
text: grenn: Tell Jon! He's in command. *to the men behind him* Let's go!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: to Olly* Get me to the top! You hear me?!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Your name's Olly, right? Listen to me Olly, get me to the top and when we give a signal, bring us back down. Do you hear me?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: And find a weapon, Olly. Fight them!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: What are you doing up here?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: The Wildlings are over the walls. Ser Alliser has fallen. The castle walls can't stand much longer.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: Ed. You have The Wall. If they try the mammoths again, drop fire on them. If the climbers get too high, drop the scythe on them.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: Two brothers now fight with me.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: ed
text: ed: Might as well enjoy our last night, right boys? Light the fuckers up. Knock! Draw! Loose!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: donnel
text: donnel: How are we gonna stop that?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: cooper
text: cooper: We shot twenty-eight arrows in him already.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: grenn
text: grenn: You heard Jon, we hold the gate.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: donnel
text: donnel: Jon Snow's not Lord Commander.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: grenn
text: grenn: We hold the gate!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: donnel
text: donnel: Mother save me. Father save me.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: grenn
text: grenn: The gods aren't down here. It's the six of us, you hear me?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: donnel
text: donnel: No, please.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: grenn
text: grenn: Night gathers, and now my watch begins. It shall not end until my death. I shall take no wife, hold no lands, father no children. I shall wear no crowns

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: all
text: all: And win no glory. I shall live and die at my post. I am the sword in the darkness. I am the watcher on the walls. I am the shield that guards the realms of men. I pledge my life and honor to the Night's Watch, for this night and all the nights to come!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: to Sam* I don't want you out there.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: You can't protect me forever. There won't be anywhere to hide if the castle falls.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: I need him more than I need you.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: We need you boy.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: ygritte
text: ygritte: Jon Snow.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: No, shh, don't talk.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: ygritte
text: ygritte: Do you remember that cave?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: ygritte
text: ygritte: We shouldo ve stayed in that cave.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: We'll go back there.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: ygritte
text: ygritte: You know nothing, Jon Snow.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: ed
text: ed: Drop the scythe, boys!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: ed
text: ed: Hoister up!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: ed
text: ed: They've had enough for one night.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: ed
text: ed: Don't cheer too loud. They still outnumber us a thousand to one.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: Tormund. It's over, let it end.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: tormund
text: tormund: This is how a man ends.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: Put him in chains. We'll question him later.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: tormund
text: tormund: I shouldo ve thrown you from the top of your wall boy!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: Aye, you shouldo ve.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Woah! It's me. It's me. I promised you, didn't I?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: We held them off.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: For one night.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: This is a great victory.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: Great victory? Mance was testing our defenses. He almost made it through. And he has more giants, he has more mammoths. He has a thousand times as many men. They'll hit us again tonight. Maybe we can hold them off for a day or two, but we can never beat them.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Where are you going?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: I'm going to find Mance.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: To...you can't do that. No one gave you any orders.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: Who's left to give orders? The Wildling army is only an army because of Mance. He united a hundred warring tribes. Without Mance they lose their leader. They lose their purpose, they go back to fighting each other, scatter back to their home.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Without Mance? You're going to kill him?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: I'm going to try.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: They'll never let you within a hundred yards of him. And if you did, even if you managed to kill him.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: He'll kill me. If I don't go he'll kill me anyway. They'll kill the rest of us too.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: He won't just kill ya. They'll boil you. They'll filet you. They'll make it last days!

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: You're right. It's a bad plan. What's your plan?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: They held the gate. Get some brothers down here to help you. You need to burn the bodies. Raise the outer gate, then lower it again as soon as I'm out.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: What are you doing?

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: jon
text: jon: I promised Jeor I'd never lose it again. *he hands the sword to Sam* In case I don't come back.

title: The Watchers on the Wall
Name: sam
text: sam: Jon. Come back.

title: The Children
Name: mance
text: mance: You're wearing a black cloak again.

title: The Children
Name: jon
text: jon: I've been sent to negotiate with you.

title: The Children
Name: mance
text: mance: It appears my trusting nature got the better of me. It's happened before. I was hoping your loyalty was real when you pledged yourself to us, Jon Snow, truly I was.

title: The Children
Name: jon
text: jon: The Halfhand ordered me to join your army and bring back whatever information I could to Castle Black. He made me kill him so you'd trust me. I was loyal, to him and to my Night's Watch vows.

title: The Children
Name: mance
text: mance: All of your vows? She wasn't enough to turn ya, eh? Were you enough to turn her?

title: The Children
Name: jon
text: jon: She put three arrows in me when I escaped.

title: The Children
Name: mance
text: mance: Did you see her again at Castle Black?

title: The Children
Name: jon
text: jon: Yes.

title: The Children
Name: mance
text: mance: And?

title: The Children
Name: jon
text: jon: She's dead.

title: The Children
Name: mance
text: mance: Your doing?

title: The Children
Name: jon
text: jon: No.

title: The Children
Name: mance
text: mance: We'll drink to her.

title: The Children
Name: mance
text: mance: Of all the ways I'd kill you, poison would be the last.

title: The Children
Name: mance
text: mance: Ygritte.

title: The Children
Name: jon
text: jon: Ygritte.

title: The Children
Name: jon
text: jon: That's not wine.

title: The Children
Name: mance
text: mance: No, it's a proper Northern drink, Jon Snow. You did well. Fought hard. Killed some of our strongest men. One of our giants went into your tunnel and never came out again. Mag the Mighty.

title: The Children
Name: jon
text: jon: He's dead. He killed my friend Grenn.

title: The Children
Name: mance
text: mance: He was their king. Last of a bloodline that stretches back before the First Men.

title: The Children
Name: jon
text: jon: Grenn came from a farm.

title: The Children
Name: mance
text: mance: Mag and Grenn.

title: The Children
Name: jon
text: jon: Grenn and Mag.

title: The Children
Name: mance
text: mance: Kullback, could I trouble you for something to eat? I don't imagine our guest has eaten anything in quite some time. So. You're here to strike a bargain?

title: The Children
Name: jon
text: jon: Turn your army around and go home.

title: The Children
Name: mance
text: mance: You know I know you're low on arrows. You're low on oil. You're low on men. How many are left? 50?

title: The Children
Name: jon
text: jon: I told Tormund and Orell. We have more than a thousand men.

title: The Children
Name: mance
text: mance: I showed you everything I had. The whole army, a hundred thousand strong, and what did you do? You fired on us with everything you had. It wasn't much. Soon as I saw that I sent four hundred men to climb the wall. An unmanned stretch five miles west of here. A lot of them will die climbing, but most of them will be over by the end of the day. This is me being honest with you, Jon Snow, which is more than you've ever done for me. My people have bled enough. We're not here to conquer, we're here to hide behind your wall just like you. We need your tunnel. Now we both know that winter is coming and if my people aren't south of the wall when it comes in earnest, we'll all end up worse than dead. Wanna strike a bargain with me? Here's a bargain. You go back, you open the gates to us and I swear to you that no one else will die. Refuse and we'll kill every last man in Castle Black.

title: The Children
Name: mance
text: mance: Ah! Oh, that's why you're here. I reckon you could do it before any of them could stop ya. They'd kill you of course, they'd kill ya slow, but ya knew that when you came in here. Are you capable of that, Jon Snow? Killing a man in his own tent when he's just offered ya peace? Is that what the Night's Watch is? Is that what you are?

title: The Children
Name: mance
text: mance: You attacking us?

title: The Children
Name: jon
text: jon: No, it's like you said, we don't have the men.

title: The Children
Name: mance
text: mance: Hold! To me. To me.

title: The Children
Name: mance
text: mance: Stand down! I said my people have bled enough and I meant it.

title: The Children
Name: stannis
text: stannis: You're the king beyond the wall?

title: The Children
Name: stannis
text: stannis: You know who I am?

title: The Children
Name: mance
text: mance: Never had the pleasure.

title: The Children
Name: davos
text: davos: This is Stannis Baratheon, the one true king of the seven kingdoms.

title: The Children
Name: mance
text: mance: We're not in the seven kingdoms and you're not dressed for this weather.

title: The Children
Name: stannis
text: stannis: It is customary to kneel when surrendering to a king.

title: The Children
Name: mance
text: mance: We do not kneel.

title: The Children
Name: stannis
text: stannis: I'll have thousands of your men in chains by nightfall, I'll have nowhere to put them and nothing to feed them. I'm not here to slaughter beat dogs. Their fate depends on their king.

title: The Children
Name: mance
text: mance: All the same, we do not kneel.

title: The Children
Name: stannis
text: stannis: Take these men away.

title: The Children
Name: davos
text: davos: What are men of the Night's Watch doing in a Wildling camp?

title: The Children
Name: jon
text: jon: I was sent to discuss terms with the king beyond the wall.

title: The Children
Name: davos
text: davos: You're speaking to the one true king boy. You'll address him as your grace.

title: The Children
Name: jon
text: jon: I know he's the king. My father died for him. My name is Jon Snow, your grace. I'm Ned Stark's son.

title: The Children
Name: stannis
text: stannis: Your father was an honorable man.

title: The Children
Name: jon
text: jon: He was, your grace.

title: The Children
Name: stannis
text: stannis: What do you think he'd have done with him?

title: The Children
Name: jon
text: jon: I was this man's prisoner once. He couldo ve tortured me, he couldo ve killed me, but he spared my life. I think my father wouldo ve taken him prisoner, listened to what he had to say.

title: The Children
Name: stannis
text: stannis: Very well. *to Davos* Take him.

title: The Children
Name: jon
text: jon: Your grace. If my father'd seen the things that I've seen, he'd also tell you to burn the dead before nightfall. All of them.

title: The Children
Name: pycelle
text: pycelle: I would suggest milk of the poppy to ease his pain but he is completely insensate.

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: Bloody Martells.

title: The Children
Name: pycelle
text: pycelle: The cause appears to be manticore venom.

title: The Children
Name: qyburn
text: qyburn: It is, yes, manticore.

title: The Children
Name: pycelle
text: pycelle: I've read a good deal about it. It's a horrible poison, usually Mantari in origin. Oh! Yes, yes. There's nothing to be done.

title: The Children
Name: qyburn
text: qyburn: Yes there is.

title: The Children
Name: pycelle
text: pycelle: May I ask what you think you're doing?

title: The Children
Name: qyburn
text: qyburn: Saving him.

title: The Children
Name: pycelle
text: pycelle: Your grace. I wish it were otherwise, but Ser Gregor is beyond saving. Well, well beyond. This man is not even a Maester, let alone Grand Maester.

title: The Children
Name: qyburn
text: qyburn: That's for the best. No Maester knows how to save him.

title: The Children
Name: pycelle
text: pycelle: That is exactly the sort of arrogance that had him expelled from the citadel, your grace. His curiosity was deemed dangerous and unnatural. Rightly so in my opinion.

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: You're dismissed, Grand Maester.

title: The Children
Name: pycelle
text: pycelle: Your grace. This is my laboratory!

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: Not anymore.

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: You can save him?

title: The Children
Name: qyburn
text: qyburn: Difficult to say, your grace, but if my past work is any guide. We stand a chance.

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: Do everything you can. Come to me with anything you need.

title: The Children
Name: qyburn
text: qyburn: Thank you, your grace. You should know, the process may change him, somewhat.

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: Will it weaken him?

title: The Children
Name: qyburn
text: qyburn: Oh no.

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: Very well then.

title: The Children
Name: tywin
text: tywin: Not another word. We've been over this, the matter's closed.

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: I'm opening it again.

title: The Children
Name: tywin
text: tywin: You are betrothed to Loras Tyrell. Still betrothed to Loras Tyrell and you will marry Loras Tyrell as soon as Tommen marries Margaery.

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: I will not.

title: The Children
Name: tywin
text: tywin: Jaime cannot marry or inherit lands. Tyrion's sentence will be carried out tomorrow. You have, on several occasions, made great claims about your commitment to this family's future. Your role in that future is more vital now than it ever was.

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: I don't care. I will stay in King's Landing where I belong with my son, the king.

title: The Children
Name: tywin
text: tywin: When you were nine years old, I was called to the capital. I decided to take your brother with me and not you. You insisted that you would not be left at Casterly Rock under any circumstances and if you recall-

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: I'm not interested in hearing another one of your smug stories about the time you won. This isn't going to be one of those times.

title: The Children
Name: tywin
text: tywin: Do you think you'll be the first person dragged into a sept to be married against her will?

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: When you marched into the throne room to tell me we'd won the Battle at Blackwater, do you remember?! I was sitting on the iron throne with Tommen. I was about to give him essence of nightshade, that's how far I was willing to go when I thought someone awful had come to take my son away. Someone awful is coming to take him away.

title: The Children
Name: tywin
text: tywin: No.

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: Joffrey is dead. Myrcella's been sold like livestock. And now you want to ship me off to Highgarden and steal my boy, my last boy. Margaery will dig her claws in and you will dig your claws in and you will fight over him like beasts until you rip him apart. I will burn our house to the ground before I let that happen.

title: The Children
Name: tywin
text: tywin: And how will you do that?

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: I'll tell everyone the truth.

title: The Children
Name: tywin
text: tywin: And what truth would that be?

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: You don't know, do you? You never believed it. How is that possible? What am I saying, of course it's possible. How can someone so consumed by the idea of his family have any conception what his actual family was doing? We were right there in front of you and you didn't see us. One look in the past twenty years, one real look and you wouldo ve known.

title: The Children
Name: tywin
text: tywin: Known what?

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: Everything they say is true. About Jaime and me.

title: The Children
Name: tywin
text: tywin: No, no, no, no, no.

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: Your legacy is a lie.

title: The Children
Name: tywin
text: tywin: I don't believe you.

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: Yes you do.

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: Jaime.

title: The Children
Name: jaime
text: jaime: You won. One fewer brother. Must be proud of yourself. There's really nothing you wouldn't do, is there?

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: For my family, no. I would do things for my family you couldn't imagine.

title: The Children
Name: jaime
text: jaime: Tyrion is your family.

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: He's not.

title: The Children
Name: jaime
text: jaime: You don't get to choose.

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: I do, so do you. You can choose the creature that killed our mother to come into this world-

title: The Children
Name: jaime
text: jaime: Are you really mad enough to blame him for that? He didn't decide to kill her. He was an infant.

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: A disease doesn't decide to kill you, all the same you cut it out before it does. What do you decide? What do you choose?

title: The Children
Name: jaime
text: jaime: The things I did to get back to you, to endure all that, only to find you-

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: I choose you.

title: The Children
Name: jaime
text: jaime: Those are words.

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: Yes. Like the ones I just said to father. I told him.

title: The Children
Name: jaime
text: jaime: Told him what?

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: I told him about us.

title: The Children
Name: jaime
text: jaime: You told him?

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: I told him I wouldn't marry Loras Tyrell. I told him I'm staying right here with Tommen, with you.

title: The Children
Name: jaime
text: jaime: You think he'll just accept that?

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: Go and ask him.

title: The Children
Name: jaime
text: jaime: What did you say?

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: I don't want to talk about Tywin Lannister. I don't choose Tywin Lannister, I don't love Tywin Lannister. I love my brother. I love my lover. People will whisper, they'll make their jokes. Let them. They're all so small I can't even see them. I only see what matters.

title: The Children
Name: jaime
text: jaime: Someone will walk in.

title: The Children
Name: cersei
text: cersei: I don't care.

title: The Children
Name: missandei
text: missandei: in Valyrian* You stand before Daenerys Stormborn, the Unburnt, Queen of Mereen, Queen of the Andals and the Rhoynar and the First Men. Khaleesi of the Great Grass Sea, Breaker of Chains and Mother of Dragons.

title: The Children
Name: fennesz
text: fennesz: in Valyrian* Thank you for seeing me, your grace. My name is Fennesz. I can speak the common tongue if you wish.

title: The Children
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: You speak it very well.

title: The Children
Name: fennesz
text: fennesz: Before you freed me, I belonged to Master Mighdal. I was tutor to his children. I taught them languages and history. They know a great deal about your family because of me. Little Calla is only seven, but she admires you very much.

title: The Children
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: I hope I can prove worthy of her admiration. What can I do for you?

title: The Children
Name: fennesz
text: fennesz: When you took the city, the children begged me not to leave the house. But Master Mighdal and I agreed that I must. So I lost my home. Now I live on the streets.

title: The Children
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: I have outfitted mess halls to feed all former slaves and barracks to shelter them.

title: The Children
Name: fennesz
text: fennesz: I do not mean to offend, your grace. I went to one of these places. The young prey on the old. Take what they want and beat us if we resist.

title: The Children
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: My Unsullied will make them safe again in short order my friend, this I promise you.

title: The Children
Name: fennesz
text: fennesz: Even if they are safe, who would I be there? What purpose would I serve? With my master, I was a teacher. I had the respect and love of these children.

title: The Children
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: What is it that you want from me?

title: The Children
Name: fennesz
text: fennesz: Your grace, I ask you to let me sell myself back to Master Mighdal.

title: The Children
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: You want to return to a man who owned you, like a goat or a chair?

title: The Children
Name: fennesz
text: fennesz: Please, your grace, the young may rejoice in the new world you've built for them. But for those of us too old to change there is only fear and squalor. I am not alone. There are many outside waiting to beg the same-

title: The Children
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: I did not take this city to preside over the injustice I fought to destroy. I took it to bring people freedom. But freedom means making your own choices. I will allow you to sign a contract with your former master. It may not cover a period lasting longer than a year.

title: The Children
Name: fennesz
text: fennesz: Thank you, your grace. Thank you.

title: The Children
Name: barristan
text: barristan: The masters will take advantage of this situation. The men serving them will be slaves in all but name.

title: The Children
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: Approach my friend.

title: The Children
Name: man
text: man: in Low Valyrian* I do not understand, my queen. I do not understand, my queen.

title: The Children
Name: missandei
text: missandei: in Low Valyrian* The Queen says you may approach.

title: The Children
Name: man
text: man: crying, speaking Low Valyrian*

title: The Children
Name: missandei
text: missandei: translating* I have brought you. He came from the sky. The black one. The winged shadow. He came from the sky and...

title: The Children
Name: missandei
text: missandei: translating* My girl. My little girl.

title: The Children
Name: daenerys
text: daenerys: What was her name?

title: The Children
Name: missandei
text: missandei: Zala, your grace.

title: The Children
Name: daenerys
